body:
**Is this a BUG REPORT or FEATURE REQUEST?** (choose one): BUG REPORT

<!--
If this is a BUG REPORT, please:
  - Fill in as much of the template below as you can.  If you leave out
    information, we can't help you as well.

If this is a FEATURE REQUEST, please:
  - Describe *in detail* the feature/behavior/change you'd like to see.

In both cases, be ready for followup questions, and please respond in a timely
manner.  If we can't reproduce a bug or think a feature already exists, we
might close your issue.  If we're wrong, PLEASE feel free to reopen it and
explain why.
-->

**Kubernetes version** (use `kubectl version`):
Client Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"5", GitVersion:"v1.5.2", GitCommit:"08e099554f3c31f6e6f07b448ab3ed78d0520507", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2017-01-12T07:31:07Z", GoVersion:"go1.7.4", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"darwin/amd64"}
Server Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"5", GitVersion:"v1.5.2", GitCommit:"08e099554f3c31f6e6f07b448ab3ed78d0520507", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2017-01-12T04:52:34Z", GoVersion:"go1.7.4", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"}

**Environment**:
- **Cloud provider or hardware configuration**: Self-Hosted
- **OS** (e.g. from /etc/os-release): Ubuntu
- **Kernel** (e.g. `uname -a`): Linux 4.4.0-59-generic #80-Ubuntu SMP Fri Jan 6 17:47:47 UTC 2017 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
- **Install tools**: kubeadm
- **Others**:


**What happened**:
When create pod with this command: `kubectl run go-http-test -it --rm --port 5000 --expose=true --image=tanapolsh/go-http-test --restart=Never`, pod don't have label `run=go-http-test` which doesn't matched with service's selector causing cannot use service to pod

**What you expected to happen**:
Every pod that is created with `kubectl run` should be assigned with label `run=${run_name}`

labels.description: Categorizes an issue or PR as relevant to SIG CLI.
labels.name: sig/cli

title: kubectl run: doesn't assign label to pod
